oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Film Center Report, 1949-1950
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Report of film center activities. Report includes construction of a residence for Fred Lasse, and the near completion of the Film Center itself. The Film Center purchased a high-fidelity tape recording system and decided on pursuing fewer projects but with a larger scope. They finished production of a film, They Met at the Fair, and are beginning a historical film on the origins of the CIO in the South. The Film Center also shot still photographs for the Southern Education Film Production Service and worked with Fisk University to construct and design an exhibit on the Race Relations Department at Fisk.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Congress of Industrial Organizations (U.S.); United Packinghouse Workers of America; Willimetz, Emil, 1918-2003; Textile workers--Labor unions; American Missionary Association. Race Relations Division; Visual education; Community centers; Audio-visual education; Art; Visual communication in art; School facilities
